revised_title: Local Solutions of Self-Dual Yang-Mills Equations Using Twistor Techniques
tldr: The author uses twistor techniques to find all local solutions to self-dual Yang-Mills equations for any matrix gauge group. The key step involves solving the matrix-valued Riemann problem on the Riemann sphere, which is expressed as a path-ordered exponential contour integral. This work has implications for understanding the physics of Yang-Mills fields and solving other nonlinear differential equations in physics.
